<title level="1" right="Rules">[Name and Traits](/Rules.aspx?ID=2391)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 430 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
The affliction’s name is given first, followed by its traits in parentheses—including the trait for the type of affliction ([curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=566), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), and so forth). If the affliction needs to have a level specified, it follows the parentheses, followed by any unusual details, such as restrictions on removing the conditions imposed by an affliction. If no level is listed, the affliction matches the level of the creature, hazard, or item causing the affliction.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
